metadata.Title: CVE-2020-35498 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A vulnerability was found in openvswitch. A limitation in the implementation of userspace packet parsing can allow a malicious user to send a specially crafted packet causing the resulting megaflow in the kernel to be too wide, potentially causing a denial of service. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

criterions.comment: openvswitch: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
